title: References (Part 16)
content:
References

References (Part 16)

Continued References [210-220]

  • [215] Siyu Yuan et al. - Easytool: Enhancing llm-based agents with concise tool instruction (2024)
  • [216] Changle Qu et al. - Tool learning with large language models: A survey (2025)
  • [217] Zhengliang Shi et al. - Tool learning in the wild: Empowering language models as automatic tool agents (2024)
  • [218] Hongru Wang et al. - Empowering large language models: Tool learning for real-world interaction (2024)
  • [219] Ling Yang et al. - Buffer of thoughts: Thought-augmented reasoning with large language models (2024)
  • [220] Kanzhi Cheng et al. - Seedclick: Harnessing gui grounding for advanced visual gui agents (2024)

Analysis & Explanation

Tool Learning Evolution

Key Advances
  • Multi-Tool: Coordinated tool usage
  • Zero-Shot: Documentation-based tool use
  • Real-World: Practical tool integration
